title: Remove 17 compiled binaries from repo root
description: Critical: Binary files (agents, simple, budget, hooks, streaming, etc.) are committed to root. These are Mach-O arm64 executables (~3.5MB each) that bloat the repo and should be in .gitignore

title: Task7: Close Method with Cleanup
description: Close with graceful shutdown, temp file cleanup
close_reason: Close with graceful shutdown, force kill timeout, temp file cleanup

title: Increase sdk package test coverage to 70%+
description: High: Currently at 66.3%, needs to reach 70%+. Add missing error path tests and improve streaming/channel iteration coverage

title: Hook-Specific Output Types - add typed variants per hook event
description: Go uses generic HookOutput. Python has PreToolUseHookSpecificOutput, PostToolUseHookSpecificOutput, UserPromptSubmitHookSpecificOutput, SessionStartHookSpecificOutput (types.py:241-276).

title: Add CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
description: Create CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md using Contributor Covenant 2.1 or similar. Essential for open source community health.

title: Implement Control Protocol (Query class) in internal
description: Critical gap: Go SDK lacks complete bidirectional control protocol support found in Python's _internal/query.py. This includes: control request/response routing, hook callbacks, tool permission callbacks, message streaming, initialization handshake. Python Query class is 621 lines handling all control protocol features.
close_reason: Already implemented: sdk/query.go has 918 lines with control request/response routing, hook callbacks, tool permission callbacks, message streaming. All features from Python _internal/query.py are present.

title: Task5: Define Options Types
description: docs/plans/01-types-interfaces.md#task-5-define-options-types-complete
close_reason: Options types with functional options pattern

title: Add SandboxSettings configuration types
description: Python has SandboxSettings, SandboxNetworkConfig, SandboxIgnoreViolations. Go has none.

title: Settings/Sandbox Merging - merge sandbox into settings JSON
description: Go doesn't merge sandbox into settings JSON like Python does. In Python subprocess_cli.py:253-271, sandbox is merged INTO settings. Go passes them separately via --sandbox flag.

title: Wrap JSON errors in JSONDecodeError in subprocess
description: Python SDK explicitly raises SDKJSONDecodeError in message reading. Go SDK has JSONDecodeError type defined but not actively used in subprocess/readMessages() - buffer overflow errors go to error channel as generic errors. Should wrap JSON parsing errors properly.

title: Example: setting_sources configuration
description: Add examples/setting-sources/ to demonstrate user/project/local settings control. Python has setting_sources.py showing setting_sources=['user'], ['user','project'], None patterns.

title: Permission validation - mutual exclusivity
description: Python validates that can_use_tool and permission_prompt_tool_name aren't used together. Go lacks this validation. Add check in client initialization.

title: Task1: Message Parser
description: Create parser.go and parser_test.go with ParseMessage function

title: Add package docs to internal packages
description: Internal packages lack package-level documentation: internal/parser/parser.go, internal/mcp/handler.go, internal/mcp/transport.go, internal/mcp/types.go, internal/subprocess/subprocess.go. Add package comments explaining purpose (even if internal, helps maintainability).

title: Create type-safe hook callbacks
description: Current HookCallback uses 'any' for input requiring type assertions in every hook. Create event-specific callback types: PreToolUseCallback, PostToolUseCallback, UserPromptSubmitCallback, etc. that accept typed input. Eliminates boilerplate type assertions.

title: Task4: Define Message Types
description: docs/plans/01-types-interfaces.md#task-4-define-message-types

title: Plugin Support - add --plugins flag and plugins field
description: Go SDK missing plugin support. Python has plugins field with plugin directories (subprocess_cli.py:295-300).

title: Add system_prompt example
description: Python has system_prompt.py example. Go missing equivalent demonstrating system prompt customization.

title: WithClient context manager pattern
description: Enhance WithClient() to provide better resource management similar to Python's async context manager pattern. Ensure proper cleanup on panic.
close_reason: WithClient panic recovery implemented and tested

title: Update module path to final namespace
description: REQUIRES USER DECISION: Current module path is github.com/victorarias/claude-agent-sdk-go (personal namespace). Ask user: What should the final module path be? Options: github.com/anthropics/claude-agent-sdk-go, github.com/[org]/claude-agent-sdk-go, or keep current? This affects all imports and go.mod.
close_reason: User decision: keep current module path github.com/victorarias/claude-agent-sdk-go

title: Fix ignored error in json.Marshal at query.go:443
description: Critical: At sdk/query.go:443, json.Marshal error is ignored with blank identifier: 'responseData, _ := json.Marshal(response)'. This could silently fail to send control responses. Fix: Check error and handle appropriately.

title: Add benchmark tests
description: Medium: Zero func Benchmark* functions. Need performance baselines for parser, JSON accumulation, hook execution

title: Create root README.md
description: Create comprehensive README.md in project root with: project overview, installation instructions, quick start example, feature overview, links to documentation, troubleshooting, development setup. Reference examples/README.md for style.

title: Parse signature field from thinking blocks
description: Python parses signature field from thinking blocks. Go parser should extract this field too.

title: Support settings file paths with sandbox merge
description: Python supports reading settings from file paths and merging with sandbox. Go currently returns error.

title: Task0: Version Check Pre-Flight
description: Add CLIVersionError, version parsing, comparison, min version check
close_reason: Version parsing, comparison, and min version check with CLIVersionError

title: Task6: TOCTOU-Safe Write Method
description: Write with mutex serialization for concurrent MCP tool calls
close_reason: TOCTOU-safe Write with mutex serialization for concurrent MCP tool calls

title: External MCP server transport integration
description: Python fully supports stdio/sse/http MCP server transports. Go has types defined but integration with control protocol unclear. Verify and complete integration.

title: HTTP MCP server transport implementation
description: MCPServerConfig type exists with Type=http but no transport implementation. Need HTTP client with request/response handling for remote MCP servers.
close_reason: Already supported - HTTP MCP server configs are passed to CLI via --mcp-config flag. CLI handles the HTTP connection. Added tests to verify.

title: Fix race condition in TestQuery_HandleCanUseTool
description: Critical: Test at sdk/query_test.go:601 has race condition. Uses time.Sleep(100ms) for synchronization instead of proper sync primitives. Variable 'called' is accessed from multiple goroutines without synchronization. Will fail with 'go test -race'. Fix: Use sync.WaitGroup or channels instead of sleep.

description: Add MCP tool call handling to query.go

description: Python has tools_option.py demonstrating tool allowlist filtering. Go missing equivalent.

close_reason: Plan05 complete: 12 examples and integration tests created

title: Epic: SDK Feature Parity Gaps
description: Track all gaps between Go SDK and Python SDK identified in comparison analysis
close_reason: Completed: Stream closure coordination, CLI version check, IsError field, buffer overflow errors, MCP image content. SSE/HTTP MCP already supported. P3 examples remaining.

title: CLI version check on connect
description: Python checks CLI version on connect and warns if incompatible. Go has version comparison functions in sdk/version.go but doesn't call them during connection. Should add check in subprocess.Connect().
close_reason: Implemented checkCLIVersion in Connect() with 2s timeout, parseVersionOutput, and CLAUDE_AGENT_SDK_SKIP_VERSION_CHECK env var support

title: Add security contact email in SECURITY.md
description: Critical: Line 30 has placeholder [security contact needed] - needs actual email address for vulnerability reporting

title: Implement get_server_info() API
description: Python SDK has get_server_info() method returning initialization info with available commands, output styles, and server capabilities. Go SDK lacks this API - initialization result is available but not exposed via dedicated method.

title: Add Makefile for common tasks
description: Medium: Missing Makefile with targets for build, test, lint, fmt, clean. Improves developer experience

description: Add sendControlRequest and handleControlResponse to query.go

title: Replace map[string]any with typed structs for control protocol
description: 89 occurrences of map[string]any in codebase, especially in control protocol messages. Makes type safety difficult. Consider creating typed structs for control request/response messages to improve maintainability and catch errors at compile time.

title: Implement Transport interface abstraction
description: Go SDK lacks abstract Transport interface that Python has. This makes testing and swapping implementations difficult. Python has Transport class with connect(), write(), read_messages(), close(), is_ready(), end_input() methods.
close_reason: Transport interface already exists in types/transport.go with all required methods (Connect, Close, Write, EndInput, Messages, IsReady). SubprocessTransport and MockTransport both implement it with compile-time verification.

title: Add hook output detailed types
description: Python has HookJSONOutput, SyncHookJSONOutput, AsyncHookJSONOutput with typed fields. Go uses generic map[string]any.

title: Unify hook registration API
description: Currently 3 different ways to register hooks causing confusion: 1) WithPreToolUseHook(matcher, callback), 2) WithHookTimeout(...), 3) Direct HookMatcher construction. Consider creating a HookBuilder pattern for clearer, more discoverable API.

title: Task5: Initialize with Hook Registration
description: Add Initialize method and hook configuration to query.go

title: Restructure: Move from flat root to organized packages
description: Current: All 27 Go files at root with 'package sdk'. Module is github.com/victorarias/claude-agent-sdk-go but package is 'sdk' - non-idiomatic. Options: (A) Rename module to match package, (B) Create internal/ subdirectories for transport, subprocess, parser, mcp
close_reason: Completed package restructuring: moved types from sdk/ to types/, updated all references including internal packages, examples, and tests. All tests pass.

description: Add StreamInput, SendMessage, SendUserMessage, SetCanUseTool to query.go

title: Stream closure coordination - wait for first result before closing stdin
description: Python waits for first result before closing stdin when using hooks/MCP. Go is missing this coordination which can break bidirectional control protocol. See query.py stream_input() method.
close_reason: Implemented StreamInputWithWait with first result coordination, timeout config, and WaitForFirstResult channel

description: Go doesn't respect user env var precedence. Python properly merges sys env -> user env -> SDK env (subprocess_cli.py:380-389).

title: Complete package restructuring (types/, internal/, sdk/)
description:
Complete the Go package restructuring started in this session.

## Current State
- types/ package: DONE (builds successfully)
- internal/subprocess/: DONE (builds successfully)  
- internal/parser/: DONE (builds successfully)
- internal/mcp/: DONE (builds successfully)
- sdk/: PARTIAL (has type conflicts)

## Remaining Work
1. Update sdk/query.go to import types/ and internal/parser
2. Update sdk/options.go to re-export from types/ or remove duplicates
3. Update sdk/types.go to re-export from types/ or remove duplicates
4. Update sdk/errors.go to re-export from types/ or remove duplicates
5. Update sdk/mcp.go to use types.MCPServer (methods moved to types/)
6. Update sdk/transport.go to re-export types.Transport
7. Fix all type references in sdk/client.go (partially done)
8. Update all test files in sdk/ to use new imports
9. Update all test files in internal/ to use new imports
10. Update examples/ to import from sdk/ and types/
11. Run full test suite
12. Update go.mod if needed

## Structure Goal
```
types/           # Standalone types (no SDK imports) - DONE
internal/
  subprocess/    # SubprocessTransport - DONE
  parser/        # ParseMessage - DONE
  mcp/           # MCPHandler, MCPServerTransport, protocol types - DONE
sdk/             # Public API (imports types/, internal/*)
examples/        # Import sdk/ and optionally types/
```

## Key Files to Update
- sdk/query.go: Add parser.ParseMessage, types.* for all type refs
- sdk/client.go: Fix remaining type conflicts (partially done)
- sdk/options.go: Remove duplicates, re-export from types/
- sdk/*_test.go: Update imports
close_reason: Package restructuring completed in previous session

title: Separate MCP Config Types - TypedDict per transport type

description: Go SDK defines ErrClosed sentinel but lacks corresponding ClosedError struct type. May be needed for explicit closed-transport scenarios during clean shutdown.

title: Document HookEvent constants

title: Buffer overflow error reporting instead of silent discard
description: Go silently discards messages when buffer overflows. Python raises explicit SDKJSONDecodeError. Should return error from addLine() and send to errors channel.

title: Document Options struct fields
description: Options struct in types/options.go has 50+ fields without inline documentation. Add field comments explaining purpose for each field. Reference Python SDK types.py lines 620-680 for descriptions.

title: Fix untracked goroutine in QueryStream
description: At sdk/client.go:368, QueryStream launches goroutine without tracking. If caller abandons channel without consuming, goroutine leaks. Fix: Add context cancellation to ensure goroutine exits, or use WaitGroup tracking.
